title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Rep. Mary Cavanagh Arrest

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Rep. Mary Cavanagh Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: February 25, 2023
Location: Livonia, Michigan
Individual Involved: Mary Cavanagh, 30
Incident Summary: Rep. Mary Cavanagh was pulled over around 2 a.m. after officers observed her swerving between lanes and driving with two flat tires. During the traffic stop, she admitted to drinking at a political fundraiser and underwent a field sobriety test, which she failed. Officers conducted a breathalyzer test, recording a BAC of .176% on scene and later .2% at the police station. She was subsequently arrested for driving under the influence.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Conducted the traffic stop and initial interaction with Rep. Cavanagh.
Administered the field sobriety test and breathalyzer.
Transported her to the Livonia Police Department for further testing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Scott Russell Granden Arrest

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Scott Russell Granden Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: March 25, 2021
Location: Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, Atlanta, GA
Individual Involved: Scott Russell Granden, 36
Incident Summary: Granden was arrested upon landing after allegedly sexually assaulting a female passenger aboard a Southwest Airlines flight. The victim reported that Granden groped her while she was asleep and later smacked her buttocks when she stood up. Upon arrival at the airport, Atlanta Police officers detained Granden, who was reportedly intoxicated and made racist and homophobic slurs toward officers. He also pulled down his pants and shouted inappropriate remarks.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the aircraft upon landing and interacted with Scott Russell Granden.
Documented Granden’s statements and behavior during his detention and arrest.
Transported Granden following the arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: June 4, 2022
Individual Involved: David Koechner (actor, known for Anchorman and The Office)
Incident Summary: Ohio State Troopers pulled over David Koechner after observing alleged "lane violations" while he was driving. Upon contact, officers noted the smell of alcohol and observed glossy eyes. Koechner admitted to consuming "one beer" and refused a breathalyzer test. Officers conducted a field sobriety test before placing him under arrest for Operating a Vehicle Impaired (OVI).
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Initiated the traffic stop and interacted with David Koechner.
Conducted the field sobriety test and any additional questioning.
Participated in the arrest and transport of Koechner.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.communication:
Dear Harun Harun: 
Thank you for your interest in obtaining public records from the Ohio Department of Public Safety.  Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Ohio Revised Code Chapter 149.  Your request was received in this office on 3/4/2025 and given the reference number R030131-030425 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: Please See attachment for description. 
Your request will be sent to the relevant department(s) to locate the records you seek. Requests are processed in the order in which they are received; please do not submit duplicate entries for the same information. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question based on your selected preferred method of delivery. PLEASE NOTE: The Ohio Public Records Act codified in R.C. Chapter 149 does not require a governmental body to create new information or records that do not already exist or are beyond state records retention schedules. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will be contacted when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Ohio Department of Public Safety - Public Records Center. 
Ohio Department of Public Safety

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Charles Snowden DUI Arrest

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Charles Snowden DUI Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: December 9, 2024
Location: Rainbow Boulevard near Sunset Road, Las Vegas, Nevada
Individual Involved: Charles Snowden (Las Vegas Raiders player)
Incident Summary: Officers responded to a report of a suspicious vehicle at approximately 11:30 p.m. and found Charles Snowden passed out behind the wheel of a running 2017 Jeep Grand Cherokee. The vehicle was in neutral and nearly rolled off a four-foot retaining wall. Upon interacting with officers, Snowden appeared disoriented, initially stating that he believed he was in Florida. A breathalyzer test later showed a blood alcohol level more than double the legal limit.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Initially arrived at the scene and located Charles Snowden in his vehicle.
Interacted with Snowden and conducted any field sobriety or breathalyzer tests.
Participated in the arrest and transport of Snowden.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sandra Doorley Traffic Stop

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 04/22/2024
Location: Webster, New York (Phillips Road and Doorley’s residence)
Individual Involved: Sandra Doorley (Monroe County District Attorney)
Incident Summary: On the date of the incident, DA Sandra Doorley was reportedly stopped for speeding—driving 55 mph in a 35 mph zone. Instead of pulling over, she called Webster Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier and proceeded home, refusing to comply with the officer’s order to stop. Bodycam footage shows a tense exchange in which she stated she "didn’t feel like stopping" and refused to exit her garage. The officer informed her that failure to stop is an arrestable offense.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Attempted to pull over Sandra Doorley for the traffic violation.
Responded to her residence and engaged in conversation with her.
Communicated with Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier regarding the situation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: May 30, 2023
Location: Miami Beach, Florida
Individual Involved: Danielle Leigh Curiel (DaniLeigh)
Incident Summary: Miami Beach police arrested DaniLeigh around 8:15 AM following a DUI hit-and-run crash that left a moped driver with serious injuries, including a kidney laceration and spinal fracture. Officers reported that DaniLeigh was speeding and swerving before striking the victim. She was later stopped and administered a breathalyzer, which showed a BAC of 0.148—nearly twice the legal limit. The arrest resulted in three felony charges, including DUI with serious bodily injury and leaving the scene of an accident.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the crash scene and interacted with the injured victim.
Conducted the traffic stop on DaniLeigh’s vehicle.
Administered the field sobriety and breathalyzer tests.
Processed her arrest and transport to Turner Guilford Knight Correctional Center.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:

Location: Palm Beach County, FL

Incident Summary: Christina Laboy was pulled over for driving over 100 mph and swerving on the road. After initially being given a warning, she engaged in a racially charged outburst toward officers, referring to one officer as "George Floyd" and making multiple offensive remarks. Booked her into custody and documented her continued behavior.

title: Crime Incident Data Request (Tulsa Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2009, 2011, and 2013
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Arrest of Monika Hladik

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Arrest of Monika Hladik
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Location: Clearwater, FL
Suspect: Monika Hladik, 41
Incident Summary: Hladik, a former managerial accountant for Inspecs USA, was arrested for allegedly embezzling $710,531 from the company between 2016 and 2022. Authorities state that she wrote 232 unauthorized checks to herself, forged her employer’s signature, and manipulated QuickBooks accounting entries to conceal the theft. The investigation began after a complaint was filed by the company president. Hladik was arrested and charged with a scheme to defraud.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the complaint and conducted any preliminary investigations.
Located and arrested Monika Hladik.
Transported her to the Pinellas County Jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: FBI support for 2020- TV  documentary series "Bloodline Detectives"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2020- TV  documentary series "Bloodline Detectives"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2020- TV documentary series "Bloodline Detectives," hosted by Nancy Grace. Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Bloodline Detectives," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Bloodline Detectives."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. title: UAB FRS

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: UAB FRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal years 2004 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

If your department does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian’s name and address.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

title: Peregrine

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Peregrine
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (California Government Code § 6250 et seq.)  I am writing to request access to and copies of all records, documents, communications, and data pertaining to the Modesto Police Department’s use, implementation, or involvement with the "Peregrine" technology or platform provided by Peregrine (https://www.peregrine.io/). All records should be from 1/1/2022 until the date this is processed.

Specifically, I am requesting the following:

Contracts, agreements, and memorandums of understanding related to Peregrine.

Policies, procedures, and guidelines governing the use of Peregrine technology.

Training materials, presentations, or communications regarding the Peregrine platform.

Reports, audits, or assessments evaluating the performance or effectiveness of Peregrine.

Correspondence, including emails and internal memos, that mention "Peregrine" or related terms.  Please also include all email correspondence to any representative using a peregrine.io email address ( *@peregrine.io ) 

If possible, I request that the records be provided in an electronic format. Please inform me of any fees for processing this request prior to fulfilling it. If my request is denied in whole or in part, please justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions under the law.



I look forward to your response within the legally required timeframe. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you require any further information to process this request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, the City shall, within 10 days from receipt of the request, determine whether the request, in whole or in part, will be made available and shall promptly notify the person making the request of the determination and the reasons therefore. Requests are received during normal business hours. City offices are open Monday through Friday, from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., excluding holidays. Requests submitted while the office is closed, such as after hours, weekends or holidays, will be opened and received the next business day. In certain circumstances, the time limit prescribed in this section may be extended by written notice to the person making the request, setting forth the reasons for the extension and the date on which a determination is expected to be dispatched. title: release of exibits presented in Indiana vs Richard Alllen

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: release of exibits presented in Indiana vs Richard Alllen
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

With the exception of exhibits that are under seal I am requesting release of all trial exhibits, in the case of the State of Indian vs Richard Allen.  Richard Allen was convicted and sentenced October 31st 2024 and the judge assured that after the gag order was lifted at sentencing trial exhibits would be made public as the transcript is being prepared. She has since then instructed her court reporter to advise the public that possibly someday these will be made available. Considering the length of time I am asking for all exhibits used in the trial that were not sealed.  Indiana Public Records Act "APRA" Indiana Code 5-14-3 et seq requires these exhibits to be made public. Considering the volumne of these exhibits some delay is understandable. Four months is no longer understandable and the excuses given to the media who have requested them are ridiculous.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christine Calderon

title: CIA support for 2015 film "Spy"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA support for 2015 film "Spy"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and the production of the 2015 movie "Spy," directed by Paul Feig and starring Melissa McCarthy. I request any and all documents pertaining to CIA support for "Spy." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of CIA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Spy," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Evergreen Solutions (Monroe Community College)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios
